threat: A remote attacker could  cause a denial of service by sending special requests that trigger  hash collisions predictably.
A remote attacker could use this to cause  a denial of service or view confidential data.
A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of  service or to bypass Java sandbox restrictions.
An attacker could us this to cause a denial of  service through a maliciously crafted ZIP file.
A remote attacker  could use this with an untrusted application or applet to grab keyboard  focus and possibly expose confidential data.
A remote attacker  could use this with an untrusted application or applet to set a new  default time zone and bypass Java sandbox restrictions.
A remote attacker could use this with  an untrusted application or applet to bypass Java sandbox  restrictions.
A remote  attacker could use this to corrupt object data.
A remote attacker could use this  with a malicious application or applet to bypass Java sandbox  restrictions.
special:
The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:
After a standard system update you need to restart any Java applications
or applets to make all the necessary changes.
